item.title: GitHub
item.description: To do the tutorial exercises you will need a GitHub account.

item.title: Set up the tutorial
item.description: Setup your fork # Fork the tutorial repository # Uncheck Copy the main branch only and click Create fork You’ll see this message as your fork is being created: After a few seconds you will see your fork. Enable issues # The tutorial makes use of GitHub issues. To enable issues click the Settings tab Scroll down to features and click Issues: Enable read and write permissions for workflows # By default, write permissions are not enabled for workflows.

item.title: Create the Exercises
item.description: There are two GitHub workflows for the tutorials. create_exercises creates the exercises. reset_exercises clears the exercises so you can start afresh. Workflows # To get to the workflows, click the Actions tab Create the Exercises # To create the exercises, click create_exercises from the menu on the left Then click Run workflow which will bring up a pop up menu: Choose the Language exercises. Text creates review exercises that do not require and code knowledge.

item.title: Reset the Exercises
item.description: There are two GitHub workflows for the tutorials. create_exercises creates the exercises. reset_exercises clears the exercises so you can start afresh. If you would like to close all the issues and pull requests at once, you can use the reset_exercises action. To get to the workflows, click the Actions tab Click reset_exercises from the menu on the left click Run workflow to open up a menu, and click the green Run workflow button:
